Multiple levels of difficulty, various options to ease you into the game such as auto-aim. There's even some weird tables and weird balls for you to try. Very decent graphics enhance the gameplay.

The story of the game revolves around a child who lost his mother in an accident but dad comes to the rescue. Her skills as a robot technician help her create a mechanical maid in the image of a young girl. This maid, named Mei, looks and acts like a flesh-and-blood helper thanks to a training base. While Mei and her friends are a part of your life, she will clean the house, learn new things, and interact with you in different ways. Maybe there will be love ...?

The player plays Ken Inami, a 17-year-old high school student. Ken has his dreams and aspirations and would like to go to film school. His girlfriend, Hotaru Shirakawa, is more interested in music and would like to go to music school. They've been dating for a while, and while they thought it could go on forever, their relationship is hanging by a thread. As Ken, you can try to save your relationship, or break up and go after another girl. The game has many different endings, depending on which girl you end up with ... or if it's the wrong ending, which girl you break up at the end.

The player plays Ken Inami, a 17-year-old high school student. Ken has his dreams and aspirations and would like to go to film school. His girlfriend, Hotaru Shirakawa, is more interested in music and would like to go to music school. They've been dating for a while, and while they thought it could go on forever, their relationship is hanging by a thread. As Ken, you can try to save your relationship, or break up and go after another girl. The game has many different endings, depending on which girl you end up with ... or if it's the wrong ending, which girl you break up at the end.

The player plays Ken Inami, a 17-year-old high school student. Ken has his dreams and aspirations and would like to go to film school. His girlfriend, Hotaru Shirakawa, is more interested in music and would like to go to music school. They've been dating for a while, and while they thought it could go on forever, their relationship is hanging by a thread. As Ken, you can try to save your relationship, or break up and go after another girl. The game has many different endings, depending on which girl you end up with ... or if it's the wrong ending, which girl you break up at the end.

Memories Off Complete is a compilation that contains both Memories Off and its prequel Memories Off: Pure. The latter can be selected as a separate scenario from the main menu. Both games contain a few re-drawn images. In addition, there is a new omake mode for the Pure scenario and a quiz mini-game.
Mercurius Pretty - End Of The Century

The magic of alchemy has sprouted new life in the form of an anime homunculus which happens to be a tiny fairy. Due to her fragile nature when she first births, you house her in an incubation chamber so that she can grow and learn under your watchful tutelage. Similar to many growth simulations, the young charge is clueless but learns under your tutelage. Feed your fairy in moderation, speak to her and teach her the ways of life.

In a dystopian future, society requires coordination by corporate decree to keep the peace. Even under the auspices of an efficiently managed system, a religious rebel force rises to raise a ruckus. As a new employee of the Company, Hojo Minagi works with fellow workers to address eruptions of unrest and squash disturbances. One day, a wandering girl named Larisa enters Minagai's life and he resolves to help her recover her memory as well as tie-in her connection to a mercenary killer named Metal Wolf. A hentai game, Metal Wolf features suggestive poses, lewd panty shots, and other adult themes which thread through the game.
Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits Volume 1 is a compilation of old arcade games for Dreamcast. The compilation offers 6 titles such as Spy Hunter, Joust, Defender, Robotron, Sinistar and Rootbeer Tapper.
This follow-up to Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits 1 contains six emulated games that were originally released in the arcades: Moon Patrol Paperboy 720Â° Spy Hunter Rampage Gauntlet

In Milky Season, the player controls a young student who has been appointed to lead the girls' dormitory. This will put you in many awkward and romantic situations where you can choose how the story will branch out and which girl you might fall in love with, depending on your choices during the dialogues. The game features 12 heroines, the characters show their attitude and disposition only in vocal and static poses. Typical visual novel elements are present during certain phases of the game.

In 2463 a race of vicious aliens has invaded human planets, wiping out the population of Novocastria first. Only the Millennium Soldier can lead the human fightback. In this sci-fi action game, reflex shooting dominates over planning or tactical play. Expect non-stop action from fighting and relentlessly killing off tons of bad guys across more than 20 levels of 3rd person 3D action, taking place inside and outside. Powering up your weaponry is crucial - there are 18 different ones to collect, from pulse cannons to particle accelerators and rockets to missiles. Two player cooperative and deathmatch modes are provided.

Conflict, war and unrest in a country in the Middle East compels a teenage princess named Sandia to stay safe from your home. Until the peace negotiations are finalized, you will serve as her companion and perhaps woo her, if you are able. 4 other female characters complete the cast of the game: Akane is your childhood friend and she sits on the student council while maintaining top notch grades in school. Tomboy Kyoko presents the image of beauty and muscles with skills in various forms of martial arts and childlike charm. Saya suffers from alienation because of her parents, who are too busy to care about her and she is the most shy and reserved of the group. Finally, the sexy Natsuki working as a waitress in a bar.

Missing Parts: The Tantei Stories is the first installment in a trilogy of adventure games developed by FOG inc for the Sega Dreamcast. The game follows a young detective named Kyosuke Magami that works for the Narumi Detective Agency. The agency was founded by a former criminal that became a famous detective named Seiji Narumi. However, after Narumi's sudden disappearance, the agency was taken over by his daughter which leads to Magami joining the agency to help find her father as well as find the answers behind an old pendant belonging to his late parents.

Same as the first episode of the game, Missing Parts 2 is a 2D on-screen interaction adventure where the detective-protagonist works through six crime / mystery episodes that test the limits of his / her / your detective and puzzle solving skills. brain teaser. A large amount of texts and conversations in Japanese constitutes the bulk of the game,

The final game in the Missing Parts series reaches the Dreamcast after enjoying a 2-year stint spread out over three games. NCS expects the series to continue on the PS2 or the PC after the third volume. Similar to previous incarnations, the Missing Parts 3 game is a 2-D flick-screen interaction adventure where the detective-protagonist works through six crime/mystery episodes which test the limits of his/your sleuthing skills and puzzle solving abilities. A hefty amount of Japanese text and conversations make up the bulk of the game.

Mizuiro was originally released as an adult visual-novel, which yielded this console port for PlayStation 2 and Dreamcast two years later. The game follows the story of Kenji Katase , a high-school student who lives with his adopted sister, Yuki . One day, Kenji's childhood friend, Hiyori Hayasaka , re-appears in his life and his long-gone feelings of affection toward her started to awaken.
As is the case with many romance-driven visual novels, your choices will determine how the story branches, and your actions will drive the story toward the heroine of your interest. While this console game version removed the adult content, it added additional character and story content with new CG events. As you play through the games, you unlock CG gallery for heroines which is accessible via main menu, along with the music player.

MoHo is a Sega Dreamcast game developed by Lost Toys and published by Take 2 Interactive in 2000. It is notable for being the only exclusive Dreamcast game for the United Kingdom, despite receiving ratings from the German USK and French SELL ratings bodies and having its back cover description translated into German.
An American release under the name of Ball Breakers was planned for release in November 2000 but cancelled near completion; three different rips of a late prototype were leaked simultaneously in 2012.

Meet Takahiro, master to five lovely maids who all willingly serve without question. Their histories are suspect and mysterious but players will soon discover the secrets within the mansion where the odd quintet reside. New to the console conversions of Moekan is a new maid named Mikoto Moeno who brings her own brand of obsessions and nervous tics to the game.
Released on the same day as Random House's Shogi title, this is a basic Reversi (Othello) title, with strong AI and a no-frills approach, for reversi fans.
Released the same day as the title Reversi of Random House, it is a basic Shogi (Japanese chess game) title, it remains a classic of the genre, for Shogi fans.

The first and only Mortal Kombat title to make onto the Dreamcast console, Mortal Kombat Gold offered players a carbon-copy of the arcade edition of Mortal Kombat 4, along with additional features and characters never before included in the arcade game.
Using the exact same engine found in Mortal Kombat 4, the game performs flawlessly on the Dreamcast platform, while also running at a higher resolution than its arcade counterpart.
Motto Pro Yakyuu Team o Tsukurou!

The title says it all. A sequel to "Let's Make Japanese Professional Baseball Team !!" or 'Pro Yakyu Team Wo Tsukurou!' in Japan, which is pushing the management of baseball teams even further. Lots of text in Japanese, so not very accessible for those who don't know the language.

Mr Driller's world has been covered with mysterious blocks. Armed with only a mighty drill, you'll have to dig your way down to safety before his air supply runs out!
Mr Driller is a real-time puzzle game that relies solely on quick-thinking and a bit of planning. Gameplay is a combination of Tetris and Boulder Dash: You have to drill down through multi-colored blocks to reach the bottom while avoiding the consequences of reckless drilling (blocks may fall on you and crush you).

A combination of exploration and classic Pac-Man (or in this case, Ms. Pac-Man) action, Ms. Pac-Man Maze Madness has Ms. Pac-Man saving Pac-Land once again, although this in full 3D.
The four Wonders, mystical regions separated from the rest of Pac-Land by force fields, contains four Gems of Virtue: Generosity, Truth, Wisdom and Courage, each holding enough power to help keep Pac-Land safe from evil. However, an unknown enemy has transformed the Enchanted Castle into a haunted house, in turn starting a chain reaction of evil all around Pac-Land and the four Wonders. It is up to Ms. Pac-Man to enter the 3D designed worlds of the four Wonders and put the evil to rest for good.

You are a little creature of the Kawaiinian family. You walk on a tiny cube and walk through various geometric shapes made up of an assemblage of cubes like yours. The cubes are of different colors and you can imagine, this has a key role since you will have to frame a series of pieces of the same color aligned horizontally or vertically using two pieces of another color. By analogy, we could speak of an Othello or a Reversi in 3D. Except here, we don't flip the pieces, we make them disappear and we let gravity do the rest!

My Merry May is the first game in a planned (but unfinished) trilogy, originally released for Dreamcast in 2002, followed by a PlayStation 2 port later that year. The story revolves around Kyousuke Watarase , a high-school student, who one day received a strange package. In that package was Reu, an AI android in a form of a young girl who ends up living with him under pretense of being his sister.
The game plays as a typical visual novel romance which includes reading on-screen text over background art and character sprites who come in different poses and gestures, but are not animated. Key moments feature special CG artwork to emphasize certain scene and break out from a typical "character sprite over background art" presentation. Aside from main characters, all the heroines feature full voice-acting. Player's choices allow the story to branch toward one of the several different endings, some endings focusing on your relationship with a specific heroine.

Life in a small town is fairly boring especially when fishing and farming are the main sources of livelihood. As an assistant teacher on your way to becoming a full-fledged educator, you also enjoy a quiet life marked by routine. One day, fate changes your life when you find a beautiful young girl who has been involved in an accident. When she wakes up, her memory has been lost and it is then that you discover that she is an artifical human. nnHelp your new charge by interacting with her and teaching her the ways of the world. A cast of characters also interjects drama and situations to keep things interesting.

The first game in the NBA 2K series; this realistic basketball simulation is Sega's answer to NBA Live.
Play an exhibition game, an entire season or jump straight to the playoffs. The game has all 29 teams and their stars. Players are realistically modeled and have recognizable faces and even tattoos - a novelty. You can also create your own players with the player editor.
NBA 2K features the 1999-2000 team rosters.

NBA 2K1 on Dreamcast, is a basketball game. Composed of the teams and players present in the NBA in 2000, the title offers as a novelty compared to its predecessor the Street mode, in which the matches are made in 2 against 2, or 3 against 3. Another novelty, the online mode allowing to be played. measure to the whole world.

NBA 2K2 is the third game in SEGA's NBA 2K series of basketball simulations. This is the first game in the series to be released for multiple platforms (instead of solely for the Dreamcast). In addition to updated graphics, rosters, arenas, team uniforms, and signature moves for the 2001-2002 season, the 2K2 edition now supports zone defenses (a new NBA rule where you have to choose to play man or zone defense), intercepting of passes, and making adjustments and actions in mid-animation.
There are detailed statistics for each team and player, for a year, the current season or an entire career. The game modes include Exhibition, Season (play a full season along with management), Franchise (more than one season), some arcade street modes and the option to create custom tournaments.

Rather than 5 on 5 action like professional play, this game features 3 on 3 play. Using players from the NBA, each player chooses a guard, forward, and center from the team's NBA roster for the first half and can make substitutions for the second half.
NBA Hoopz is an arcade-style game and not meant to be realistic: players can jump twenty or thirty feet in the air, dunk the ball from 20 feet (6.1 m) away, and do otherwise physically impossible things. Fouls are only called on flagrant pushes, foul shots are rare (and only after a number of fouls are accumulated), and there is no out of bounds. In addition, after a player makes three consecutive shots he becomes "on fire" which allows him to make almost any shot as well as goaltend without penalty.

NBA Showtime: NBA on NBC is a descendant of the original NBA Jam, and is created by some of the key team members. The game follows in the footsteps of NFL Blitz, featuring the option to save personal records and a cheat code system operated by pressing a sequence of buttons. It also features unlock-able characters, including NBA team mascots, and the "On-Fire" option that defines Midway's sports games. Players are able to perform special moves such as the alley-oop, the spin move, and the double dunk. The game also features a Create-a-Player mode that allows custom players to have tweaked abilities by winning matches.
NCAA College Football 2K2 : Road to the Rose Bowl

NCAA College Football 2K2: Road to the Rose Bowl is an American football video game developed by Visual Concepts in association with 2K Sports. It was released in 2001 for only the Sega Dreamcast. The cover athlete is former Purdue standout quarterback Drew Brees.

NFL 2K is the first of Sega's NFL franchise to hit the Dreamcast system. It is also the first football game of the "128-bit" generation, making it the game that most future football games get compared to. NFL 2K features VMU play calling, accurate stadium models, and a play editor.

NFL 2K1 is the follow-up sequel to the popular NFL 2K for the Dreamcast. NFL 2K1 provides several upgrades to the series, including individual team playbooks, an improved passing model, an improved running game, and online play.
This game features all 31 NFL teams, season and franchise modes, a practice mode, a play editor, over 2000 motion-captured animations, and the ability to download updated information from the Internet.

NFL 2K2 is a complete football simulation, giving you a variety of ways to play. You can compete in a single exhibition game, start up a franchise, or move directly to the playoffs, uses a TV-style presentation, featuring telestration, action replays, sideline animations, stadium lighting and a director feature that zooms in on the play. Included in NFL 2K2 are all the teams and plays from the 2001-2002 season, including stadiums and uniforms. You have the option to choose a team and select your own roster, or you can create your own team and take them through a franchise.

New edition of Midway's "NFL Jam" action/sports game where the emphasis is on bone-crushing action rather than sport simulation.
Additions this year come in the form of a season mode, a simpler passing system based on preset buttons (gone is the "aiming" mechanism) as well as a limited yet functional play-book editor.
Also included are new audible calls and voice-overs, smoother animations and new stadiums to play in.
Supports multiplayer gameplay of up to 4 players in one single machine! (two on keyboard, two on gamepads).

No refs... No rules... Just 'classic' gridiron. Late hits, pass interferences, and other penalties are encouraged (though you can't run offside). Cheerleaders in, well, cheerleading uniforms liven up the end of the first and third quarter and there's enough stats to make the mathematically inclined happy. However, the teams features are not entirely based on real life (Indy was at the top), and it is not as addictive as the old-fashioned PC games of the early 1990's, but still a good game for someone who doesn't mind not-so-classic, almost XFL style football.

The final QC title on N64 follows in the similar footsteps of the previous three titles on the console, with a full on NFL football simulation with all the teams, players and stats.
Modes include Exhibition, Season, Practice & Pro Bowl, with the option to play past NFL Super Bowl games our create your own custom simulation.
You can also create your own team and players, a full play book, and sign or trade players pre-season. Up to 4 players are supported.

QC returns for another season. For the third time around, improvements over the previous titles include far more player detail and animations during plays (thanks to 1200 motion captured moves) and more moves and strategies.
In terms of gameplay, the usual assortment of options are included, from full team management (trades, drafting, etc.) to create a player and create a team modes. Play with 4 people in Tournament, Season, Playoffs, Pro Bowl and Exhibition games, along with the chance to re-live past Super Bowls.

Ice hockey featuring all 28 NHL teams, rosters, and arenas from the 1999-2000 season.
Play an exhibition game or play through an 82-game season, including the All-Star Game, culminating in the playoffs where you vie for the Stanley Cup.
You can also trade players as the GM and create up to 40 players.

NHL 2K is a series of hockey games by 2K Sports for the Dreamcast, PlayStation 2, Nintendo GameCube, Xbox, iPhone, Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, and the Wii. Initially discontinued after the release of NHL 2K11 in 2010, the brand was revived on mobile devices in 2014. The games are officially licensed from the National Hockey League and NHL Players Association. While its games were released on consoles, its main competition was EA Sports' NHL video games.
Nakoruru - Ano Hito Kara No Okurimono

This game tells the story of one of the characters in the SNK Samurai Spirits fighting series: Nakoruru. Nakoruru: Anohito kara no Okurimono is a visual novel. The player listens to the dialogues between Mikato and other people, reads his thoughts on what is going on. Every now and then the player will need to choose one of the two or more options available which will lead to different dialogues or scenes. There are also some simple mini-games (such as playing a melody on a musical instrument).

A total of 12 games are offered in Namco Museum:
Pac-Man, Pac-Man Arrangement, Galaga, Galaga Arrangement, Dig Dug, Dig Dug Arrangement, Pole Position, Pole Position II, Ms. Pac-Man, Galaxian, Pac-Attack et Pac-Mania. For the first time since their arcade days, Pac-Man Arrangement, Galaga Arrangement and Dig Dug Arrangement are ported to the home console. Everything is exactly the same as the original arcade versions, including the music, cut scenes, graphics, and even the many graphical errors that appear.
Nanatsu No Hikan - Senritsu No Bishou

Friends Kei and Reina land on a mysterious island and search for their friend Ernest. But along the way, they encounter many different monsters in the different mansions they discover. It's up to them to defeat these foes, find their friend, and understand the mysteries of the island.

The player controls Arsia, a young girl, wandering the town of Napple, and to restore peace, Arsia and her familiar creatures will need to collect six petals. Although the game is primarily a platform game, there are a lot of people to talk to. Exploration parts are mostly in Napple with a 3rd person view, while platform levels are 2D side scrolling. In these levels, Arsia usually has to complete them and fight a boss.

Golden Logres is a pinball simulator from LittleWing. Following from Tristan and Crystal Caliburn, the game features three tables based on Arthurian legends: Camelot, Land's End and Fisher King. After completing all the missions on a table, the game moves on to the next one. A practice mode is available to test the last two tables and prepare for the full game.
Neppachi - 10-ren Chan De Las Vegas Ryokou

The Neppachi series has 6 games on the DC, digital online versions of Pachinko, popular slot machines in Japan. the plus was the DC's online feature of winning real prizes while playing. This 1st title in the series defines the model for the rest, giving access to a few Pachinko machines and several others options, including the ability to change pin positions. It's colorful and noisy, like in real life.

The Neppachi series has 6 games on the DC, digital online versions of Pachinko, popular slot machines in Japan. the plus was the DC's online feature of winning real prizes while playing. The 2nd title in the Neppachi series, which differs little in terms of `` gameplay '' from the 1st title, features a single machine that uses the `` Harenchi Gakuen '' franchise, a manga phenomenon from the 70s.
Neppachi 3 - CR Dokonjou Gaeru 2, CR Dokonjou Gaeru H

The Neppachi series has 6 games on the DC, digital online versions of Pachinko, popular slot machines in Japan. the plus was the DC's online feature of winning real prizes while playing. The 3rd game features a few tables and Japanese music, and has all the features of the first 2, so expect 3D with colorful graphics and a cacophony of sound typical of pachinko rooms.
Neppachi 4 - CR Aa!! Hana no Ouendan 3

The Neppachi series has 6 games on the DC, digital online versions of Pachinko, popular slot machines in Japan. the plus was the DC's online feature of winning real prizes while playing. the 4th game is based on a manga from the 70s (translated as `` Ah! That pep Squad '') continuing the model presented by the previous titles. It looks as beautiful as the other titles and the sound is loud as always.

This game forms part of @VPACHI, an online pachinko/pachi-slot video game service and associated video game series for the Sega Dreamcast. It was run by Daikoku Denki, a large pachinko manufacturer. The game allowed you to win actual prizes, and when you win once you weren't able to enter the tournaments again. There were 25 tournaments planned.

The Neppachi series has 6 games on the DC, digital online versions of Pachinko, popular slot machines in Japan. the plus was the DC's online feature of winning real prizes while playing. the 6th and final game offers nothing different from its predecessors, same attractive 3D graphics, pure hard pachinko and plenty of options for diehard fans.

Atmark's Net Versus series features 7 board game titles for the DC, all released at the same time, simple looking. It starts off a little weird, as the intro sees a spaceship, planets, and, uh, no chess at all. There is no doubt that this is linked to the functionality of the online game. On the menu of the game itself, it's simple menus, and while there is quite a bit of customization, everything is very basic. As the only chess title in DC, the game conveys the tactical vibe of chess well. Solo or 2 player always possible thanks to offline play.
Net Versus - Gomoku Narabe To Renju

Net Versus - Gomoku Narabe to Renju is based on the Japanese board game Gomoku Narabe, meaning Five in a Row, and it's also known as Gobang in the West. The Renju subtitle refers to the professional rules that make the game more difficult for the black player (who always goes first) thus making the chance of victory more even for both players.

Continuing the Net Versus series, this title brings the historic institution of Hanafuda to the Dreamcast. A hanafuda card game usually has 48 floral cards divided into 12 sets of 4 cards, each set representing a specific "flower" and a month of the year or moon (the Japanese character has both meanings, both plausible depending on the point view adopted).

Despite some sources, the game of Go (also called Igo in Japan, hence the title here) and Othello are not the same. This ancient Chinese board game, renowned for centuries as a tactical and deep gaming experience. The goal is to have more control of the board than your opponent, by surrounding their pieces with yours. the game of GO is very subtle and tactical. Very popular around the world and has thousands of adaptations.

This time Net Versus is unsurprisingly tackling Mahjong the ancient Chinese tile-based game. Mahjong is a board game of Chinese origin that is played by four players, with pieces called tiles. Combining tactics, strategy, calculation and psychology, as well as a more or less important part of luck depending on the rule played.

Reversi is the original name of the game 'Othello', very popular in Japan, another from the 'Net Versus' series which is focused on online gaming with a basic and clean look. If you're an Othello / Reversi fan, you'll know what to expect, and flipping records and trying to control the board is a simple, but tactical affair.

Shogi, or Japanese Chess, is the latest game in the "Net Versus" series, and perhaps the most mysterious for those unfamiliar with this Japanese board game. Similar to chess, this is a tactical warfare game popular in Japan, but you are going to need to know the rules before tackling this title, as it is more complex and not easily accessible for non-Japanese people. It was possible to play online at the time.

Net De Para - Nekosogi Paradise is a bit of a weird game, as it mixes the usual aspects of a visual novel and dating simulation, with board game mechanics. Thus, in addition to many screens to read while developing relationships between the different characters, it is also necessary to roll the dice and move between the different areas offered. It looks like a lot is going on, with 6 characters on set.

A fun low-budget version, Netto De Tennis is another example of Capcom's online vision for DC, allowing players to compete against each other via the console's modem. In a cartoon style based on sprites from older tennis titles and Capcom Sports Club's own arcade machine. It's fun, colorful and happy, good tennis with a retro charm. The single player options are limited to single matches, which is a real shame.

Nettou Golf has never been released in the West and that's a shame. Featuring anime-style graphics, it's very beautiful and the courses are lovely, with little touches like buildings reflecting in the water and falling leaves adding a plus. Ditto for the designs of the courses, which are varied and difficult. The gameplay itself is pretty straightforward, all the usual club and shot type choices are present, but to shoot, just one movement of the analog stick down. It works surprisingly well, and complex shots can be done with a bit of skill. The game offers several single player modes and tournaments, as well as an online experience, the 1st online golf game for console.

Makoto is a student who never attends the lectures at the school. As a punishment, he has to attend an extra seminar on an island with other classmates. However, when he arrives on the island, strange thing start happening. A girl is found dead on April 6th, with a small bell in her hand. Immediately after that, Makoto finds himself in bed and sees the date - April 1st! Was the vision of the girl just a dream, or does he possess the power to predict the future? This is what he will have to find out as a series of strange deaths make his seminar much more suspenseful than he would have thought.
Never7 is a visual novel. The player reads text accompanied by still anime-style pictures and from time to time makes decisions, which branch the plot, lead to different endings, and unlock new scenarios.

This is a new version of The Next Tetris with online play over SegaNet. It includes the original Tetris along with The Next Tetris, which involves color combinations and cascades. This game features a new look and new electronica music.

Adam Crowley, from the original Nightmare Creatures, is back to unleashing creatures in London. As Wallace, you must fight the monsters, rescue your lover Rachel, and travel across nine levels in search of Crowley and the final battle.
Nihon Pro Mahjong Renmei Kounin - Tetsuman Menkyokaiden

The most serious of mahjong games, Tetsuman Menkyokaiden puts the competitive side on Dreamcast and does a good job of recreating the mood of the game. It can best be described as a professional Mahjong `` sim '', and although it is only playable solo, it has enough for the hardcore mahjong player to get comfortable.

The year is Kanei 17, a dark time of thoughtless violence, where the fires of civil war still burn. Drifting in this world is a lone swordsman: Sougen, the swordsman with two shadows. Forever an outcast, he ends up on an infamous island known as Awashima, home to strange demons and unexplained events. This island may hold the secret to Sougen's curse, but can he find the answer and make it out with his life?
Nijyuei (Double Shadow) is a standard Japanese-style erotic adventure game: read the story, occasionally making decisions, and watch as events play out. As with most conversions of this kind, the console versions removed the adult content. As the game takes place in what is described as a realistic historic setting, it features the "Phrase Instruction System" which will explain events and vocabulary that may be unfamiliar to a modern-day player. The game also includes a CG mode where previously-seen events can be viewed.
Nishikaze No Kyoushikyoku - The Rhapsody Of Zephyr

Rhapsody of Zephyr is a Korean-made role-playing game and a side-story in The War of Genesis series. Unlike most other installments of the series, it has less tactical elements and is more close to the traditional Japanese-style RPG format.
The story of the game is loosely based on Alexandre Dumas' famous novel The Count of Monte-Cristo. The game is set in a pseudo-European New Age environment (17th -19th centuries). The hero of the game, a young nobleman Cyrano Bernstein, is betrayed by his fiancee Mercedes and is captured by the evil warlock Cesare Borgia. After fleeing from the prison, Cyrano swears revenge, and sets off to find a legendary sword sealed on a nearby island and to recruit allies in order to get involved in a war between two powerful empires.

Nobunaga no Yabou - Reppuuden (Nobunaga's Ambition: Tales of Storms) is the eighth title in the series, released in February 1999 for Windows 95, with ports for Macintosh, PlayStation, Dreamcast and PlayStation Portable released later. The game is set during the Kingdoms period in Japan. As the title suggests, the player is tasked with achieving the ultimate goal of warlord Oda Nobunaga; the conquest and unification of Japan. Selecting Nobunaga is optional, however, as the player can also choose from a variety of other regional daimyo of the time.
Nobunaga No Yabou - Shouseiroku With Power-up Kit

Nobunaga no Yabou - Shouseiroku is the 7th title in the series, released in March 1997 for Windows 95. This game features a new map, representing the entire country on a grid. Versions for Macintosh, PlayStation, Sega Saturn, Dreamcast, PlayStation Portable and mobile phones were subsequently made. The game is set during the Kingdoms period in Japan. As the title suggests, the player is tasked with achieving the ultimate goal of warlord Oda Nobunaga; the conquest and unification of Japan. Selecting Nobunaga is optional, however, as the player can also choose from a variety of other regional daimyo of the time.

"I have many things to tell you and very little time... I come from a universe parallel to yours. My world is desperately in need of your help. Only YOU can save us."
Responding to the desperate pleas of a mysterious character from another dimension, your soul must enter the dark and futuristic city of Omikron. This heralds the beginning of an epic adventure through an increasingly strange and dazzling parallel world, trying to solve the many puzzles that prevent you from escaping alive. Think, fight and interact with the immense gaming environment to defeat the menacing demons that have tried to trap you.
Omoide Ni Kawaru Kimi - Memories Off

Omoide ni Kawaru Kimi is the third main game in the series. The protagonist of the story is Shougo Kaga, who enrolled in a college for no particular goal. He is somewhat lazy and instead of diligent studying he spends his time leisurely and playing. Aimlessly spending his days as it were, he started feeling vaguely depressed. This brooding mood started a couple of years ago when his girlfriend, Kanata Kurosu, suddenly disappeared without saying a word. She left him heartbroken and without a reason why she ran off. A couple of years later, the two of them meet by chance at a cafe Shougo was frequently visiting.
On par with previous two main titles in Memories Off series, player affects the story by selecting different choices and different girls he wants to be with.

Ooga Booga is a party-game on Dreamcast. The action takes place on a tropical island that emerges from the waters with each full moon, it is then the opportunity for the four tribes to compete in many games aimed at harvesting magic, thus preventing the explosion of the volcano present on the island.
Casual Game, Adventure, Action / Adventure, Action
Ogami Ichiro Funtouki: Sakura Taisen Kayou Show

The goal of the player is to become the main character, Ichiro Ogami, and to create the stage work titled "Benshuu" with the members of Hanagumi. The video, which is played in "story" mode, realistically reproduces the main part of the show's program. Six types of minigames are available, including "village layout" and "mogiri" by SD characters. A large "Kayo Show" database is also included, such as performance images, rehearsal images, autographs for each character. The types of items that can be received vary depending on the event that occurs, so this is a highly replayable video game.

Orange Pocket's story takes place in a rural area in Japan near a large mountain and river. The protagonist, Hideaki Eda, is attending East Tsukuda Academy (東津久田学園, Higashi Tsukuda Gakuen) and is experiencing an enjoyable life. One day, Hideaki's childhood friend Nazuna Ayase returns from the city and starts attending his school. She adapts to a rural life quickly and soon things start to become noisier as Hideaki begins to hang out with more girls from his school.

Orion's puzzle collection is a compilation of 3 puzzle games: - Yopaz IceStar A puzzle game with 40 levels in 3 worlds, a high local score and a built-in level editor! - Yopaz 3D The 3D version of Yopaz IceStar, where you have to collect all the diamonds and avoid the enemies, but this time in a 3D world! - Turtle Chomp A fun puzzle game. Try to make the longest fruit line and chain together combos! Make the best Highscore and compete with your friends!

A Tactical RPG never released outside of Japan. Based on a popular card-based game from the 90s, the main character, Rai Seishou, learns that she is the `` Crystal Star '', and embarks on a quest to restore balance to the world and defeat the darkness. The game plays is the same as a typical Tactical RPG of the genre, with turn-based gameplay, spells, character leveling, and more. etc. It has a splendid artistic style and the difficulty level is high, not to mention the language barrier.
Simulation, Japanese RPG, Role playing games

You might be good enough to join Interforce, a private enterprise formed to fight terrorism, but to lead the team, you'll have to prove you're better than the other members. Outtrigger is a combat game that features both first- and third-person perspectives, and while it comes with a batch of single-player scenario missions, the game favors multiplayer mayhem. A split-screen mode for up to four players allows friends to compete in-house, and online cooperative play lets you form teams over the Internet. Settings include castle ruins, an observatory, abandoned train stations, and more. The game's cache of weapons includes flamethrowers, photon torpedoes, and rocket launchers, to name a few.

POD SpeedZone is the sequel to the original POD for the PC. It is a simple, futuristic racer, where you are able to attack your opponents. You are a miner on the colony of Damethra, and an alien virus has taken over the cars on the colony, creating mutant cars. It was one of the first games playable on SegaNet, and one of the only games to support the Dreamcast Broadband Adaptor. This game features eight different vehicles to use on five 3D tracks.
Pachi-slot Teiou - Dream Slot - Heiwa Sp

Three highly detailed Pachi-slot machines from the Heiwa Monarch Series are recreated faithfully on the Dreamcast for near perfect simulation of the original mechanized parlor versions. The first machine is fairly recent, having only been released in Japan earlier this April 2001, called Exhaust which beams out a racing theme complete with vroom and boom aurals. Next, we're pleased with the cool Lupin the 3rd pachi-slot machine with it's Lupin sights and sounds. Finally, the Sakura Fubuki pachi-slot features medieval Japanese lords and cherry blossoms in a romantic theme. An online mode allows network connected gamers the ability to download special bonuses and new prizes to enhance the pachi-slot machines. For those slightly confused as to the nature of pachi-slot, think of Las Vegas slot machines - same theme, different prizes.
Pachi-slot Teiou - Dream Slot - Olympia Sp

Another Pachi-Slot title for the DC, this one brings another trio of slots to the console, this time from `` Olympia '' (which appears to have been a separate company, acquired by Heiwa a few years before this release) . There is little to add to the comments made on its sister title, `` Heiwa SP, '' same display same audio and same gameplay.
Another example of Pachinko game on Dreamcast, audio and visual for pachinko fans is here. Flashy visuals and a lot of noise, recreate the atmosphere of the pachinko rooms.

Dreamcast version of Pandora no Yume is a PC port of Pandora no Yume which additionally includes new CG events for each of the heroines and fan disk sequel scenarios for each of the characters which are integrated in the main game story.
While PC CD-ROM version (as well as updated PC DVD-ROM special release) feature adult content, Dreamcast version has all the sexual content removed.

Panzer Front is a realistic World War Two tank combat simulation spanning the summer offensive into Russia of 1941 to the fall of Berlin in 1945. Nearly 25 historical missions are provided in which the player can control USA, Russian or German forces. Nearly 30 realisitically modeled tanks are playable along with 7 fictional ones and dozens of other vehicles that make up friendly and enemy forces.
Patisserie Na Nyanko - Hatsukoi Wa Ichigo Aji

Patisserie Na Nyanko - Hatsukoi Wa Ichigo Aji, the game is about the wonders of pastry ... and love. The game itself is a traditional Japanese-style adventure simulation game, complete with a multiple choice conversation system and branching storyline. Shouichi has spent most of his life living and working in his father's bakery. Like many young men, he left home to go to college after graduating from high school. However, Shouichi's father fell ill, and now Shouichi has to go home to run the store. In doing so, he will be surrounded by beloved friends and forced to deal with long-standing family issues.

A racing game where you play as one of several animals known as Pen Pens. The goal is to walk, swim, and slide across the finish line the fastest. Unlike other racing games though where you hold a button for gas or tilt forward to run, you have to tap the A button in a rhythmic manner to match your strokes with the motion of your Pen Pen.

Welcome to the first worldwide console RPG!
1. Up to 1,000 players per server. 2. Real time combat with many weapons from PS previous games 3. Create your own character by modifying race, profession, body proportion, hair, outfit, and more.
And you can even play offline if you want.

The world's first online console RPG gets an update with PSO Ver. 2. New items and weapons, new online games and play modes, a Dressing Room, new areas to explore, and the Ultimate Difficulty mode have been added. You can also bring in your PSO characters, modify them in the Dressing Room, and attempt Ultimate Mode and strive to reach Level 200!
PSO Ver. 2 functions as a stand-alone game, as well as an add-on. You don't need to have owned PSO in order to play.
Philia is the sequel to Elansar. Explore three worlds and solve over 15 puzzles by trying to understand how they work, and enjoy a nice background loving story.

Pia Carrot e Youkoso!! 2 originated on PC in 1997 as a adult visual novel simulation game. The following year the game was also released on Sega Saturn. Four years after its initial release, in 2001, the game was ported to Dreamcast, but the port removed all adult content and reduced rating to all ages. The game was released under the title Pia Carrot e Y?koso!! 2.5.
This is the second Dreamcast release which came two years after Pia Carrot e Y?koso!! 2.5 and changed the cover artwork and title back to Pia Carrot e Y?koso!! 2. It also includes a bonus mini-drama CD featuring story from Pia Carrot e Y?koso!! 3.

The storyline in the new Pia Carrot E Youkoso!! 3 takes place at the new seaside Pia restaurant where help is needed. Waitresses from the other three Pia joints volunteer their services to the new eatery and of course, you are there. Help out with the daily goings at the restaurant, date the ladies and juggle your life between work and romance.
Pier Solar and the Great Architects

Pier Solar is a love letter to the rich, imaginiative 16-bit RPGs of a bygone era. It was originally designed and developed for the SEGA Mega Drive & SEGA Genesis. Yes, you read that right!! It was actually the only freshly developed of its kind in the new millennium. It's not a port, fan translation, or a copy of any other game. Pier Solar is a 100% brand new, entirely original,16-bit RPG with an original world, storyline, soundtrack, characters, enemies and a unique battle style.

Pizzicato Polka: Ensa Genya for PlayStation 2 and Dreamcast is port of an adult PC (Windows) visual novel called Pizzicato Polka: Suisei Genya released half a year earlier. Despite the fact that console releases retain mature rating, the sex scenes have been removed and story adjusted to work without it.

Indulge yourself in a totally new concept, created by Sega for its world of Online gaming and experience a new form of online communication. Planet Ring is and 'Online Theme Park', containing many exciting elements which you can only experience through Dreamcast. Initially there were 4 mini attractions (games) on this Planet, each is simple but addictive - Dream Dorobo, Ball bubble, SOAR and Splash. Together with other amenities such as RING Messenger and many entertaining events to be introduced in the future, this is truly a gamers paradise!

Plasma Sword - Nightmare of Bilstein is the successor of Star Gladiator released for Playstation. Like it's predecessor it was first released on Arcade before ported to the Dreamcast.
The game features 22 anime-like Characters in a 3-dimensional futuristic world - except for the backgrounds and the menus, which are plain 2D-bitmaps without a lot of movement. The stages are unlimited in all directions, so it's not possible to fall of the edge. The speciality of this game are the so called "plasma moves", visually very appealing special moves filling the complete screen which can be executed when you have collected enough "plasma power". Despite of the 22 characters there are only 11 different move layouts, as one layout is shared by two characters.

The title of Takuyo's Plus Plum is a puzzle fighter a little different from the others. Each piece has weight (which increases as your opponent does combos), and the goal is to force your opponent's platform down. Added to this, the colors of the assigned piece can be changed. Each color has a pair that it can be interchanged with during the drop. Once the combos are successful, the remaining pieces can also change color ... and that is, everything gets complicated.

This simulation game was originally released for PlayStation as three separate games, each focusing on a single heroine. The Dreamcast version includes all three heroines: Yumi Aida, Shizuka Houjouin, and Fumio Ueno. While the PSX version supports PocketStation, the Dreamcast version uses visual memory which also uses graphical representation of the character you are interacting with, and emphasizes what is currently happening on the main screen. You can meet the girls, buy them gifts, talk to them, check the progress status, and play various mini-games. The game also includes printed stickers of all three heroines with some additional artwork as well.

Pop'n Music 8 was released in 2002 in the arcades, and later in 2003 for the PlayStation 2. It has less courses then the previous game but introduces more characters and songs. This was the first Pop'n Music game to have a theme - in this case, the theme is springtime.

Pop'n Music 2 on Dreamcast is a rhythm game recognizable by its bright colors, very rhythmic songs and wacky characters. Notes scroll, from top to bottom, and when the note reaches the bottom line, the player must press the corresponding button in order to imitate a note in the song. Accuracy is judged from Great (exactly the right timing) to Poor. It's your turn.

Pop'n Music 3 is one of the many titles in Konami's long-running rhythm game franchise, and the first of two "Append Discs" that require either Pop'n Music 2 or another Key Disc in the series in order to play. This particular release includes new music from the arcade version, and also includes many of the secret unlockable songs and modes from the previous releases available from the outset, in addition to new high-difficulty options such as Hi-Speed and Turbo settings in Survival mode.

pop'n music 4 is one of the many titles in Konami's long-running rhythm game franchise, and the second of two "Append Discs" that require either pop'n music 2 or another Key Disc in the series in order to play. This particular release includes new music from the arcade version, and also restores the Beginner mode that has been previously removed from the home releases.

Surf Rocket Racers is a jet-ski racing game for the Dreamcast. As in most aquatic racers, success here depends on your ability to smoothly handle unpredictable waves and aggressive competition at the same time.
There are several game modes to choose from. First up is the Championship. In this mode, you compete in a series of circuit races and accumulate points based on your finishing position. The racer with the most points at the end of the season wins. The other modes include a trick competition, a hazard and obstacle course, and a head-to-head 2-player mode.

The creators of Street Fighter add a new dimension to 3D fighting. In Power Stone, 2 fighters take to multi-level arenas with Power Stones and other weapons lying around for use.
Each game contains Power Stones. When you have enough stones (between three to five), your character transforms into an almost unbeatable warrior, with an all-new range of moves (although this does not last for long).

The world's most revolutionary fighting game does it again! Power Stone 2 takes go-anywhere, grab-anything combat, and introduces awesome new innovations to the hit arcade fighting series. Now, up to four players wage insane battles in fully interactive, multi-level stages. Master over 120 different items used in battle - weapons, vehicles traps, power-upsand more! As if chaotic swashbuckling battles weren't enough, combine forces with other players to battle monstrous bosses to win the game!

Prince of Persia: Arabian Nights is a platform game on Dreamcast. This is the Dreamcast adaptation of the title Pince of Persia 3D. The Prince of Persia must go through fifteen levels, each more difficult than the next in order to save his princess.

Take care of a princess and perhaps develop a romantic relationship with her or members of the royal party. To upgrade the PC original, publisher Alchemist adds a new love interest to the game and includes a new game introduction. Full voice acting also enhances the Dreamcast conversion.

Princess maker collection includes Princess maker and Princess maker 2. - In Princess Maker, a young orphan named Maria comes into your life. When you meet her for the firt time, she is only 10 years old. As Maria grows up you will teach her martial arts, decorum, reading, arithmetic, etc., until she is 18 and ready to take on the world as a woman.
- The 2nd opus is located at the beginnings of the original, adds politics, rivals and a world to explore. You are a war hero and the gods have decided to bless you with a girl. She was 10 years old when you met for the first time and her name is Olive Oyl. Thanks to your advice, Olive learns life, has to work, babysit, do housework, farm or choose among other jobs. Shape your daughter into the type of woman you want her to become someday.

PRISM HEART is a Japanese erotic video game developed by Pajamas Soft released for the Dreamcast on November 29, 2001 with the adult content removed. Meister is the main protagonist an is given a pocket watch to him in their childhood by his best friend, Princea. He comes from his hometown for the purpose of being a knight. At first, his swordplay grade is bad, but he improves his skill in his training.

PRISM HEART is a Japanese erotic video game developed by Pajamas Soft released for the Dreamcast on November 29, 2001 with the adult content removed. Meister is the main protagonist an is given a pocket watch to him in their childhood by his best friend, Princea. He comes from his hometown for the purpose of being a knight. At first, his swordplay grade is bad, but he improves his skill in his training.

Arc System Works is known for its Guilty Gear (and more recently BlazBlue) fighting game series, but they've released in a wide range of genres over the years, and it's their only visual novel on the DC. The thrust of the story here, sees the main character Shoji invited to a beach resort by a friend from school, where events soon take an odd turn with the repetition of the same day. Each part of a day sees small changes, like locked areas or slightly different events. It plays out like a standard visual novel.
Play the game of mahjong against a skilled assortment of suited salarymen and women. Some are cunning and will take your stake within minutes while others will whittle for hours.

This compilation contains the following three tables of Empire's Pro Pinball series: Pro Pinball: Timeshock! Pro Pinball: Big Race USA Pro Pinball: Fantastic Journey The first part of the series, Pro Pinball: The Web, is not included.
Pro Yakyuu Team De Asobou Net!

Baseball game. The data for each player is the data from the latest 2000 version. The number of former OB players has also been improved. Added "Tokkun" mode for beginners in baseball games. Sub-modes such as the popular "Home Run Pack" have also been improved.

The same big-headed characters and a slightly comical presentation, "Let's Make Japanese Professional Baseball Team!" From Sega! But this time, rather than just managing a team, you can also play baseball.
Pro Yakyuu Team o Tsukurou! (or Let's Make a Pro Baseball Team!) is a baseball team sports management video game series.
Pro Yakyuu Team O Tsukurou! And Asobou!

The inevitable merger of Sega's "Let's Make" baseball game series, which combines "management" titles with outright "game" titles. Since both game series were popular in Japan, it's no surprise that this title is. It is also not surprising that the language barrier here is quite high, especially on the management side.

Witness to the murder of his father by the mysterious Lan Di, the young Ryo Hazuki swears to find him to avenge his father. This is the starting point of this extraordinary adventure that is Shenmue on Dreamcast, a game at the crossroads of a multitude of genres that includes its share of action and confrontations inspired by martial arts.

Project Justice is the sequel to Shiritsu Justice Gakuen: Nekketsu Seishun Nikki 2. It once more thrusts you into the shoes of a team of students, trying to find out what is causing all the bizarre events.
Players pick a school to fight for and smash their way through the other schools, questioning them until you find out what is happening. The gameplay is very similar in style to the original Rival Schools, featuring bombastic special moves and team-up attacks, along with the same, highly caricatured students.

Psychic Force 2012, the sequel to Psychic Force, is a one-on-one fighting game with a twist. The matches take place inside a giant floating cube. You are able to fly, using your psychic abilities, around a 3D arena with six walls. Each of the ten available characters, Might, Regina, Wendy, Emilio, Setsuna, Patty, Gudeath, Genshin, Carlo, and Gates, are controlled with three buttons: guard, weak attack and strong attack. The effect varies with the distance. Next to the regular life meter, there is also a power meter. By using special moves, the meter is drained and your moves are limited. It is possible to recharge, and the capacity of the power meter expands when you lose a lot of health.

Psyvariar 2 is another specimen of the recent breed of "newschool" arcade shoot'em'ups (other examples being Ikaruga and Border Down). As many other recently released shoot'em'ups, it combines basic arcade shooter gameplay with modern 3D graphics to liven up the genre. The level backgrounds as well as all enemies are modeled in full 3D, with the action taking place in a vertically scrolling two-dimensional plane which moves through the level.
Puyo Puyo Da! Featuring Ellena System

Arle Nadja and her friends take some time off from Puyo fighting and challenge you to dance with them. The game features several dance stages similar to those of Dance Dance Revolution. It also introduces a new ELLENA system used to render the game as well as a new exclusive character featuring the same name. One can dance to a variety of J-pop tunes.

Puyo Pop Fever on Dreamcast is a puzzle game in which the goal is to align the Puyos of the same color in order to make them disappear. If you manage to make several lines in a row, you can block your opponent who is solving the same puzzle as you. In addition to the classic mode, discover variations of the game that allow you to see the gameplay from other angles.

Puyo Puyo~n (also called Puyo Puyo 4, based on a Japanese playword), is the fourth installment of the Puyo Puyo puzzle game series. It features a three-stage beginner mode and a single player story mode, where the main character (Arle) and (in console versions) the allies she meets along the way encounter different characters in a circus setting, and engage them in a Puyo Puyo puzzle battle.
Story Mode features different rules per level (ex. Point Puyo can drop instead of Nuisance Puyo, a certain number of colors can be used, etc.) and special attacks that can be engaged with multiple chains. Other modes include classic Puyo Puyo and a battle mode for up to four players.

The hip character from the 1980's returns in a new, 3D puzzle adventure. This time, you must help Q*bert save his friends, while solving all of the detailed 3D level that are part of 4 unique worlds, while avoiding the bad guys at the same time. And that's no easy task. Powerups litter the levels, while warp points can get you out of all those sticky situations.

Quake III Arena on Dreamcast is a multiplayer oriented first person shooter. A varied and complete arsenal is at your disposal to organize a happy butchery alone or in teams. The classic modes of the genre are all there (Capture The Flag, Possession, Deathmatch ...). The major advantage of this episode on console is the possibility of online play.
Quiz Aa Megami-sama - Tatakau Tsubasa To Tomoni
A quiz game based on the famous animated series Aa Megami Sama. You'll have to answer all the goddesses' questions in order to advance in the adventure. Includes scenes and conversational sequences.
Role playing games, Quiz / Japanese, Quiz

The sequel to F1 Racing Simulation recreates the 1997 season, featuring 17 authentic tracks, 11 teams and cars with their 22 drivers. The Monaco license is used, although the teams themselves are not licensed. A total of 22 camera views are provided.
Telemetry is stored and analysed in a similar way to Grand Prix 2, and physics are modeled to be realistic. There are eight different modes to race, the new ones being a career mode in which you start with a poor team and must drive well enough to earn competitive rides, and scenarios recreating key races for particular drivers. Returning from the first game are Time Attack, a full championship, and a 50s retro mode. There is also a track editor to create your own tracks.

Radirgy is a vertical-screen top-down bullet-hell shooter originally developed by Milestone for Naomi arcade system and later released on Dreamcast. Setting itself apart from many other top-down shooters on the system, the game features bright, cartoony, cell-shaded graphics. At the beginning, the player is given a choice of three different mecha-ships - one with a spread-gun, a weak homing laser, or a slow but powerful bubble gun. Additionally, each ship can use a sword for anything that gets too close, or specific enemies which can't be killed otherwise, a shield, which appears at the front of the ship once the player lets go of the fire button, and a smart-bomb-like field that can be extended around the player in a small circle, damaging enemies, absorbing their shots and turning them into points.
Shoot'em Up, Action, Shoot'em up / Vertical

Establish yourself as a mogul to be reckoned with as you work your way up the ranks of the railway industry in this strategy game. Expand your domain across continents and a changing global marketplace.
Build the Transcontinental Railway or the Orient Express. Run Steam train through the jungles of Africa, or electric trains through the Swiss Alps. Run your competitors out of town on a rail.
An 18 scenario campaign lets you re-create history's greatest railroading feats and failures.
Your wealth can be built up with a sophisticated stock market with margin buying, short selling, and hostile takeovers.

Another shooter in the Cotton saga. Trouble brews in the homeland of Cotton's long time friend Silk, as the evil demon Suede steals the legendary Willow candy from the queen's castle. Seeing as how no one can face Suede and his forces Silk drafts Cotton in order to restore peace to her land, but she may have forgotten that Cotton is a big fan of Willow candies herself...

A gang of pirates have invaded Rayman's world to seize its unique creatures and sell them to an intergalactic circus. Our mighty hero, Rayman, has been captured and stripped of his powers. He flees captivity and embarks on a dangerous mission to return to his conquered world where he must liberate all of his imprisoned friends from the pirates.
Just like Bugs Bunny: Lost in Time, the game is rendered in full 3D and contains action, adventure and mind twisting puzzles!

Re-Volt is a racing game where you take control over one of more than 28 R/C cars and drive on one of the 13 tracks. The tracks are varied, and include a toy shop, a supermarket, a luxury liner and more. It is possible to play a "reversed" (backwards) or "mirror" (reversed left and right) variety of each track. There are also 4 levels of realism to choose from.

Ready 2 Rumble Boxing on Dreamcast is a boxing game where fun and good atmosphere prevail. About twenty boxers, more or less funkys are offered. Under its light airs, the game is actually very rich, the possibilities of movements, parries and dodging are particularly numerous.

Ready 2 Rumble: Round 2 is a cartoon style boxing beat 'em up with plenty of strange looking characters to choose from and beat the hell out of. You can train your character up to the best of his/her ability and then fight the best in the world for the championship belt.
Round 2 adds some new play modes and characters into the mix of previous fighters. In this round, there are now 3 levels to the RUMBLE combo gauge (much like a Street Fighter game). Once you reach the third level, you can hit your enemy for six, out of the ring and into the crowd.

Mizu Sakura is a Tokyo elementary student who is transferred to a new school. There, she falls in love with a boy named Hiroshi Nonoichi. The two decide to elope together, fearing that nobody will accept their relationship at such a young age. However, Mizu never shows up for the meeting; a while later Hiroshi learns that she has been transferred to another school.
Several years have passed. Mizu is looking for a job and Hiroshi attends college. It looks like both have moved on with their lives. But their past catches up with them when they learn about a mysterious disappearance in the subway system.
Real Sound: Kaze no Regret is an audio game: it has no graphics or other visuals of any kind. Gameplay-wise, it is identical to visual novels, with written text and images being replaced by sound. The player listens to the voice-acted story, which is occasionally interrupted by a chime, prompting the player to make a decision and branch the plot.

In this game the player takes the role of an ancient warrior who has been brought to life by the benevolent wizard Wart. It seems that the evil goddess Kardis is about to be resurrected by her faithful servants. The only way to stop them is to gather famous heroes from Lodoss War universe and to defeat the evil ones in a battle.
Record of Lodoss War is quite similar to Diablo gameplay-wise. It is an action RPG which is heavily combat-oriented. You can directly control only the main hero, while the legendary heroes who join him on the quest are controlled by the AI. As you go through the game you level up, tweak your items with the great Ancients system, and gain new spells. It is also possible to froge weapons and to imbue them with runes. As your adventures into the surrounding land go on, you can return to your HQ, the Goblin Fortress, and get much needed healing and healing potions (free of charge).

The agreement between the Earth Council and the Haak Delegates came about, not through political or military means, but by financial measures. Three years after their mother-ship first orbited the earth the Haak were invited to the surface in peace and in the search for mutual rewards.
This agreement has been upheld for 7 years with only the occasional backlash causing small localised human/Haak conflict but the Haak have kept up their end of the bargain - until now.
We have started to lose contact with the human installations around the Haak settlements. The first three recon forces sent to investigate the disturbances were shot out of the air. The Red Dog Tactical Response Team is now preparing for war.
As commander of the Red Dog assault vehicle, your job is to rid our people of the now aggressive Haak forces currently occupying the continents of planet earth. Good Luck - Don't dent the tank!
Action / Adventure, Shooter / Vehicle, 3rd person, Shooter, Action

Shooter and action game Redux: Dark Matters immerses you in gameplay punctuated by fast-moving actions. You will have to go through 7 totally different worlds but respecting a common characteristic, the permanent difficulty.

Reel Fishing: Wild is a fishing simulation. It allows players to catch 2 dozen species of fish in 14 different locations around the world, from Japan to North America and South to Oceania. Dreamcast fishing rod controller is supported for added realism. The game begins in the Fishing Lodge, where players can view a glossary of fish, their catch list, and their stock of lures, reels, lines and rods. Going on a fishing trip is done via the fishing log, which presents players with a series of challenges.

Another PC game with erotic content, ported to the Dreamcast with much of its content censored. It's a classic visual novel and the gameplay is standard for this style. the school setting is fairly standard, but the artwork and soundtrack are of high quality. For fans of the genre.

Rent A Hero No. 1, a remake of the original Mega Drive game, was released for the Dreamcast in 2000. It features similar events to Rent A Hero, this time adding Rent A Hiroko, a female counterpart of Taro. The fighting engine used for the game is the same used for Sega's Spikeout games and allows the player to receive hints via in-game email.

The action of Resident Evil: Code: Veronica on Dreamcast originates two months after the events of Resident Evil 2 and 3. Claire Redfield still in search of her brother Chris, infiltrates Umbrella, but is unmasked, then imprisoned on an island. Once released, she must face the creatures, once again victims of the T-virus.

The survival horror Resident Evil 2 on Dreamcast takes place a few months after the events of its predecessor. The T-virus has managed to spread and the entire city is now infected. You control Leon S. Kennedy and Claire Redfield, and will have to try to survive and unlock the secret of the Umbrella organization.

The survival horror Resident Evil 3: Nemesis on Dreamcast takes place during the events of Resident Evil 2. This time you play as Jill Valentine, and must escape alive from Raccoon City, ravaged by zombies. Nemesis, the exterminating monster of the last survivors is on your tail.

Revive on Dreamcast is an action / adventure game. A gang of students discover a disused building that once belonged to the navy. The latter find themselves trapped inside and discover that the crew has disappeared under mysterious circumstances. You will have to find a way out in one piece.

Rez is a fast-action shooter that takes you deep into the world’s computer network. The “Project K” Network has recently been upgraded to handle the rapid expansion of the information age and the core, known as “Eden,” holds the most advanced artificial intelligence the world has ever seen. Unfortunately, Eden cannot handle the ability to create her own thoughts and buckles under the pressure in an existential breakdown. She is lost deep inside the system, and you’re the only one that can bring her back online, saving the world from utter chaos.
You must blast complex viruses, unlock passwords, and destroy firewall bosses as you search for Eden. Each stage is in a constant state of flux dependent on your shooting techniques, which ultimately control the music and colors of your environment. The deeper you get into the dreamlike cyber world of Rez, your form will evolve or devolve depending on your progress.

When Robert, a scientist at a private virus research facility, suddenly and mysteriously dies, newly hired researcher, Meg Rainman, begins to investigate her boyfriend's death. Aided by an ex-lover, Jack Nikson, Meg discovers that three other scientists died in suspicious circumstances on the same day as Robert. All four of the lab workers died while playing "The Ring", a new computer game.
Meg, determined to solve the mystery, install and begins playing the game. She is transported into a world of mystery and horror, and must travel between the Real and Imaginary worlds to find a cure to stop this dreadful virus from spreading.

Roadsters on Dreamcast is a racing game made up of three classes of vehicles (A, B and C) for as many tournaments to be won in pole position. The victories allow you to accumulate a little nest egg that can make some changes to your car, and at the same time make it more competitive.

Chain-smoking Neji Taihei is an average Japanese guy, lives by himself in his apartment, and is kind of a loser. Naturally, just letting the guy continue being a loser isn't particularly interesting, so a spirit that happens to also live in his apartment starts to toy with his daily life.
You can affect Neji in two different ways. If he's not around, you can interact with things in his apartment like moving his table, or locking his door. If he is around, you can throw little ping-pong balls at objects to focus his attention on them. If you throw too many too fast, though, he'll get depressed and ignore you.
Roommate Asami - Okusama Wa Joshikousei - Director's Edition

Asami Onohara is a cheerful, outgoing, and somewhat clumsy middle school student, but she has a secret: she is married to her physics teacher! Other than his parents, no one knows, and it must remain so until he graduates. Roommate Asami is a spin-off of Datam Polystar's Roommate series based on the manga Okusama wa Joshik? Sei (My Wife is a High School Student) by Hiyoko Kobayashi. The game is played in a standard visual novel mode from the teacher's perspective. Each day is divided into 4 segments, and at certain times it is possible to visit different places in the city, which will lead to different events. During conversations, there will be choices to be made from several responses, which will affect the flow of the story and thus different endings. The "Director's Edition" has higher resolution CG images and a bonus disc with dramatic tracks and vocal material.

Roommate Novel: Yuka Sato is a standalone visual novel not related to previously released Roommate games which focused on Inoue Ryoko heroine, developed by the same company. Unlike in previous games, this game emphasizes word "novel" in its title by having the game play resemble that of a visual novel without built-in clock and time progress as in previous titles. Heroine in this story is Yuka Satou (?? ??) which one day suddenly appears on your doorstep. You returned to your hometown from Tokyo for the summer, and you end up sharing a place with Yuka during the holidays. The text screen with player choices appears over the entire image instead of a dialogue window, and choices made by the player will lead to one of multiple endings.

During the 2050s, approximately 1 / 10th of Japan is now underwater due to the effect of global warming. The city of Tokyo was no exception. The economy of Japan is damaged by this disaster and the government is inclined to do anything to help revive the country. As a result, the Japanese government forms "JESAS", a military organization with the evil intentions of controlling the future of Japan. JESAS manipulates the launch of nuclear waste into the cosmos. To ensure their protection against other countries, JESAS has developed "R. B". Robotic weapons, which are controlled by pilots with "A. I".
On the other side, a group called "Green Frontier", an international protection agency that was formed by countries sharing the same goals: to save the Earth.

Rune caster is a strategy / rpg simulation game, create monsters, create completely original spells in creation mode. Contains a wide variety of combat events. A two-player combat mode is included. Of course, you can also summon other monsters by creating spells.

Rune Jade is a four-player multiplayer online game for Dreamcast, courtesy of Japanese developer Hudson. Though the online service officially ended on September 30, 2001, the game let players connect and play online with fully customizable characters. Character classes included knight, ninja, necromancer, and wizard.
The game can be played offline as well, as any party characters not controlled by players will be controlled by the computer. The adventure begins in the floating island country called Sonia, where demons are about to break free of the seal that keeps them under control.
The game was planned for an international release but was only shipped in Japan.

Rush Rush Rally Racing didn't receive many reviews due to the title's release on the Sega Dreamcast, which at the time of the game's release had been out of production for eight years. BeefJack gave the game a score of 8.8 out of 10, citing the focus on difficult gameplay which required multiple playthroughs, and high level of presentation for not only an indie game but a Dreamcast game in general, as highlights: "a steep learning curve that works in favour of the title. As you master these levels and progress through the challenge is constantly with you, always keeping the gameplay fresh and intense...Because of this races always remain highly enjoyable as even after repeated plays things here never become stale. It's certainly a system that requires you give a little to get the most out of it, but it's ultimately very rewarding".

It is the year 2025. Sega (yes, that Sega) has been setback with financial troubles and staff lay-offs. You've just been hired as the new CEO. Your mission? Get Sega back in the black. Armed with a new console, new developers, and a small but loyal fanbase, you plan to do what Sega has never done in the past: not only win the console wars, but achieve global domination.
This unique management sim is a Japan only release.
Saka Tsuku Tokudaigou - J. League Pro Soccer Club o Tsukurou!

Saka Tsuku Tokudaigou: J.League Pro Soccer Club o Tsukurou! is a football and team management simulation. Make the right choices at your players, refine your strategies, your tactics to reach the final and become the champion team of Japan.
Build And Management, Simulation, Sports / Soccer, Sports
Saka Tsuku Tokudaigou 2 - J.league Pro Soccer Club O Tsukurou!

A true 'sequel' to the 1st of DC's 'Let's Make' football management titles, for much of the title it is very familiar to anyone who has played the 1st. But, it's a genre that revels in annual updates, tweaking aspects of the game, adding more up-to-date information, and making slight tweaks to make a better game and it does here. There are more options, more tactical choices and a slight graphical facelift, the base game hasn't changed dramatically.
Sports / Soccer, Sports, Build And Management, Simulation
Popular Japanese cartoonist Sakura Momoko created Chibi Maruko-chan and Coji Coji manga. This game is a collection of entertaining mini games starring the cast of Coji Coji.

The gameplay of "Sakura Taisen" is a combination of Japanese-style adventure, "dating simulation", and strategic turn-based combat. Most of the game is spent exploring the theater, to which your military base is disguised. Depending on your decisions - where to go, which girl to look for, how to answer the questions (there is a time limit for responses) - you'll develop different relationships with the girl, which will influence not only further dialogues and the ending, but also their parameters in battles. During combat, you navigate your hero and the girls over the field and attack the enemies physically, or charge for powerful special attacks. Each turn you can perform two different actions, and your walking distance, as well as attack range, is limited and unique to each character. There is no experience points system and also no equipment.

This second puzzle game taken from the Sakura Taisen license uses the same gameplay as the first Hanagumi Taisen Columns but adds a new notion. Sakura Taisen 2 characters like Reni and Soletta have been added, and more are to be unlocked. The modes are complete: Arcade, Story (several scenarios), Puzzle and 2 Players. The game even allows you to face an opponent via the internet.
Sakura Taisen 2 - Kimi, Shinitamou Koto Nakare

Being a direct continuation to the first "Sakura Taisen", the second installment is very similar to it graphically and gameplay-wise. The game is divided into adventure and battle modes. In adventure mode, you control Oogami Ichirou, moving around the theater (to which your base is disguised), trying to initiate conversations with the girls and choosing timed responses, which influence your relationship with the girl and also her parameters in combat. Battles are pre-set and take place on large isometric fields, on which you navigate your mech-piloting girls and Oogami Ichirou himself, fighting enemy forces in turn-based combat. There are two new characters in the game, and several refinements to the timed answer system.
Sakura Taisen 3 - Paris Wa Moeteiru Ka

"Sakura Taisen 3" retains the basic gameplay style of the series, being a hybrid of adventure (with timed responses during conversations with the girls, and the possibility to conquer the heart of one of them), and strategic turn-based battles. The game features fully 3D graphics for the battles and the map of Paris (although the locations in adventure mode are still 2D still images).
